reviews.text: Much ado about nothing, just a quite ordinary clock tower, but.interesting as it.is one of 3 structures in the town to have survived WW2. Set in nicely maintained gardens, a pleasant spot. 30 mins more than adequate.
An historical clock in KK. But there is nothing much to see when you reach there. However, do visit the clock before the exact hour to hear the chimes of the clock. 😊
Old school but scary. U can see ghost at 12:00 am. Not clean
Historic landmarks, the area need to be kept clean always.
It's an ordinary clock tower but what's good is its historical significance.
Sunnyside is an amazing park, I was there for the Coca Cola Classic Disc Golf Tournament. Awesome weekend.
Loved the park with the rolling hills and trees. Had a wonderful firepit and frisbee golf
Nice relaxing place to picnic or just chill and listen to nature.
Nice quiet place to camp without the noise. Secluded and safe
Nice playground equipment, lots of shade trees, not much traffic. Nice place to have a picnic and play.
Friendly staff, nice food. We had a banquet for 7 people with a pile of beers. Loads of well prepared, tasty food and reasonably priced as well.
Really nice surroundings lovely friendly staff and great food.  Brilliant value for money.  Well worth a visit.
Fantastic food and friendly service. Only place that has good aromatic crispy duck. They make some great food.
Would give zero stars if possible. Food was terrible, and the service was even worse! Avoid like the plague.
Remember that You have to pay extra money for rice. Beef was... lets say "good" and the service really nice.
Nice place with historical value.Just the park is not properly maintained especially the facilities and cleanliness.Foods are good too.
Relax place n hv food court around with asean cuisine
The area is badly maintained. The beautiful park is run down. The eateries provide very limited choice of food. The toilet is dirty.  I hope those in charge can do something to fix the problems.

The memorial nothing to comment. But the food court just beside the memorial, 6 yrs ago is the best of the best food court in town ever. Easy to attract domestic tourist .Now its worse of the worse, the toilet not as clean as before, the lighting is bad, one side dark,one side bright( the bulb full of dust ). The playground dark and dead, the chairs and table look out dated and old, the counter for drink is worse, not many choice anymore though the staff is nice,  sometimes we worried if the spoon and fork really clean or not. The floor is dirty bcus of the stuborn dirt, very difficult to remove. No comment to the stall owner, they doing their best. Its look like a place coming to ghost town. My suggestion sacked the manager who look after this place asap. This place is one of the best spot to attract tourist or local. We still able to upgrade or make it happen as there were. Do not sell this land to the foreigner. Wake up !. This place is the best spot ever. Sacked the Manager now.! Or the director.
Had the best butter prawn dish at the food court. Worth it !
Contains important Islamic relics such as Kris and bookbook inscriptions but they are in Bahasa Melayu. The introduction of Islamic associations in Sabah and around the wld are in English though.

reviews.author_name: GRENDLINE TRAVEL KK Car Rental Kota Kinabalu
reviews.text: Arrive here n good place
Nice place..with all the traditional house...but their maintenance are a bit slow
I've been there during march. A very well maintained museum but the location seems a bit hidden though. Informative displays but a lot could be improved to attract more people to this museum.

A great place to visit especially if you're interested on doing a research/learning more about Islamic Civilization in Sabah. The only problem is that the location isnt as strategically located (because it is pretty well hidden even the locals didnt know much about this museum) compared to Sabah Museum. Hoping this museum can attract more people in the future.

This holy place brings that level of calmness and happiness which can't be described in words. May the lord bless everyone! This place is full of lights and the aura and environment is just next to heaven. The silence of the church, the silent whispers of the prayers, the father's voice , are still so fresh in my eyes. One must visit!

Visited this church on my trip to Delhi...huge church..welcoming and friendly people..a very nice parish priest met us after mass and thanked us for participating in the service. Sunday morning church Goers clad in Sweaters and Scarfs on a chilly morning. Thank you for an Awesome Experience..God bless you all!!!

Well maintained campus as well as the Church. 
Peaceful in ambience when no mass is being conducted but full of life otherwise. 
Cultural fest and mela along with annual celebrations are conducted at a great scale involving media n high end security. 
Regular folks are allowed to visit at all times.
So peaceful and photogenic. Loved it. Though for Christians but I still visit. Also Bangla Sahib is at a walkable distance, so do visit it

Nice church in New Delhi.
Loved visiting to share my experiences with friends around the world.
A clean area... a really clean area. 
Places can be clean even if you do not take your shoes off. 
Funny India
Travel to many places but never forget to perform solah.  Here the uniqueness of this mosque is the structure and the floor layout.  Such impressing architecture.
A mosque to worship for Muslims. A beautiful building visited by many tourists from all over the world

Just nice.. It is the place where the muslim pray and do their religious things.. Its also a tourist attraction and can come to take a pic.. But, there's a reminder for a tourist, please keep your manners and respect other religion..
All right I really love how it looks like, it might be the best looking mosque in whole Malaysia
It is one of the beautiful mosques I have seen. Looks like a floating mosque.

Rm1 per entry. Ideal for jogging, outdoor exercises/family time and just chilling by the huge lake. There's a playground, cafe, benches, store, and free drinking water. Background music constantly on play. Musical fountain starts at 7pm. One of the best places to be, in my opinion.

Perdana Park is a recreational park suitable for individual and family. It has a nice big man-made pond surrounded by jogging tracks. At night it offers visitors the chance to watch colourful waltzing water. It has a few cafe too.
#perdanaparktanjungaru

Nice place to go for a stroll or, if you're up to it, a jog on the purpose-but track around the lake. Enjoy the musical fountain and light show as well after your jog, and if you have kids, they can also enjoy two playgrounds available the. Make sure you bring a change of clothes for them!
Love these musical water fountain. Excellent park with all people jogging around. Beautiful !
Great place to jog. Could do with more trees and shrubs. Overall, awesome family gathering area
Mostly Australian soldier who fight the japanese invention during ww2. Buried here.
Not sure if its a public place where we can visit. Big area of parking place next to the park.
A very nice place to visit. Historical place after all.
Theres nothing much to see there, but the people are friendly
Well maintained memorial garden that remembers an important part of WWII

Fantastic little spot for bird watching, lots of butterflies too. It is probably worth arriving early to catch a glimpse of Kingfishers etc. 1.5km walk around the site with plenty of shade, decent mobility required and insect repellent is a must! 15rm entry for tourists.

Nice area for a walk and hike. Unfortunately not many birds to spot! If you are lucky you see some kingfisher and in the hide-out some egrets. But the mangroves are really fascinating!
It is easy to have a walk back via the observatory to have a nice overview over the city.
Wetland park with a lot of crabs. Convenient walk way and bird watching tower.
Good place to visit..but now there are no more bird..

a beautiful mangrove forest.
#farewell #Seeyousoon #wetlands #YuichiroWatanabe @Yujin

If the skies are blue and the wind dies down enough for the water to be still, you'll have a Kodak moment waiting for you. Very beautiful mosque. Not sure why so many tourists are having problems here - dress respectfully and pay the nominal fee to enter the private property and nobody will hassle you.
I Felt good and grateful to pray here. Kids were so happy playing around, and I even saw couples had a photo wedding in front of the Masjid. What a fascinating modern architecture!

I very much enjoyed my stay here. As a visitor you are asked to cover yourself properly. However, proper clothes can be rented for a small fee at the entrance of the mosque. 
What I appreciated the most was my guide  Fatin who answered every question I had regarding the mosque or Islam.

One of the tourists hotspot and home to the iconic blue mosque. Easily reach via main road. However, entrance to the mosque compound is restricted and permission is required due to few indecent events happened in the past.

Great place to experience culture.
Has refreshment area (food shops) for more culture exploration
Always a best place to visit when in KK. Peace of mind and blessed place.
Sivan Temple with fish pond underneath and surrounded by gardens. Fantastic environment for praying.
Beautiful & well managed temple. Serene emvironment
Good place to visot and get the blessing of Lord Shiva
Brought a friend from KL to here few days ago, place was very nice and clean.
Good place for praying for Buddhist
I've learned that i still have a lot to learn.
Serene, beautiful, classic and peaceful. Definitely a place worth visit for all the travellers especially buddhist followers.
Peacefully Quiet
Yes I am overwhelmed  by this very newly added wing to the existing TEMPLE.Ecstatic.stunning.Seeing is believing.Amituofo

Brilliant half day, we had an excellent tour guide Ansun (?spelling) who made the tour fun and very interesting! You get to sample food and drinks and learn about the different tribes as well as a super fun dance performance! Food was buffet lunch and catered for vegetarians. Would highly recommend!

I definitely loved my visit here. The guides are very informative and friendly. Walking around the area feels like your are really travelling back in time where you witness activities of the tribesmen. The local artifacts are authentic. The food is great as well! There is also a free henna tattoo by one of the local people there that you can try. And lastly, the cultural performance is really amazing. I am a Filipino and I have heard such ensemble of instruments play but the rhythm and its sound is really different. It is unique and enjoying. You definitely have to visit this place.
A lot changes since the last time I visit here. Great place for you to learn the history of tribes in Sabah. Buffet looks delicious.

Well what can I say? Some of the other tour groups were very pushy and unfriendly. I think if the groups were spread out more it could avoid some of the problems I faced. The village and the people were amazing and were as authentic as it is possible to be. The village was just excellent. Our tour guide Popoi was really great. Wonderfully  engaged and a great sense of humour too. Well done to all there.

Lots to enjoy here with food & drink tasting, trying out a blow pipe, looking at the clothes & customs & houses of main indigenous groups in Borneo. Hands on food and drink tasting. Some hot food (rice, noodles, chicken, fruit ) provided at the end after the.music and dance performance.

Beautiful church. Daily Mass is in the chapel on the left of the main church. Entrance is hidden between the buildings, so it was a little hard to find. No kneelers in the main church, but it's a beautiful, peaceful place to pray. Thankfully they keep the church accessible during the day, which is nice.

A classic church that was built before and actually survived the Chicago fire. Tons of history. Beautiful interior with very picturesque stain glass windows. It is in the heart of old Town with scenic walks straight down to the lake and Lincoln Park Zoo.
This is a church built based on mid 19th century Bavarian churches. The interior is worth a visit. Keep in mind that I am not a Catholic, so I am purely looking at the architectural aspect. 🙂.
This is a beautiful sanctuary in an historic church. I got to sing Handel's Messiah with other members of the Apollo Chorus as guests of the church's Schola Cantorum.
Many GREAT MEMORIES, WHILE ATTENDING @VAN GORDER WALDEN SCHOOLSCHOOL...@GREGORYDANIELS@JoanLoPrestI@@Amazingedibles

Really fun wildlife park for the whole family. Good paved walkways with a surprising amount of shade. This is definitely one of the few stroller friendly attractions. Really cool and find to see animals. The small shows they have in the ampitheater were fun as well. Try to go early in the day so the animals are more active a d done forget bug spray.

Most of the animal are in a good condition.. I really fall in love with  the tiger, they named it as 'cacat'😂 and also the snake called "rocky".. The staff was so friendly, they willing to entertain us and answer all of my questions..  I will bring my youngest sister here one day

Ideal for viewing animals for young children. The best performances without stage are gibbons, otters, orangutans and proboscis monkeys. They love the attention. The tiger looked a little sad and lonely tough.

Price for adults RM10, for child RM5. Overall the money paid is okay la because it took us around 2 hours to fully visit all attractions. Make sure to eat before you go since there are no food stall once you get inside. I still need to criticize the well being of the place as it is not in a good condition. The place looks dull and not very attractive to the eyes of visitors. If the management could improve on that, perhaps it could motivate people to come again and promote it to others.

Nice..just if u using grab make sure u have a driver back,else it hard to get back. All are nice..I love watch the animal show..the snake are cute. If you can't find any driver, do ask security guard to help, they can help find a friend who do grab or mycar service.
The staff there very attentive and responsive.  The food here is healthy as less salty. I like it. Order 3 food here for 2 and me and my bf was so stuffed. 🤣🤣

A great place for Italian cuisine. Really authentic. Love the thin crusted pizza, super crunchy. They also offer different styles of pasta which is a whiff of fresh air than the standard carbonara and Bolognese. Though, the tiramisu was way too rich. Probably because there was way too much cream and barely any biscuits. The coffee and alcohol was supposed to cut the richness down but there was barely any in ours. Overall though, great service paired with great food

Excellent RIB eye
Great sunset view and good service
Best Aglio Olio I have tasted so far. One of the best Pasta place in the heart of Kota Kinabalu. Definitely a must come for pasta lovers and it was prepared by Italian chefs too 😁
Nice food and special

Don't order from here as if you fall asleep you don't get your order or your money back so please don't order from little Italy pizza really bad review go to pizza hut as its a lot better than this place

I moved out of Aberdeen a year ago and what a loss it is not to have Little Italy around.. I simply cannot find a pizza restaurant with the same quality pizzas as this.

Expand! And for every newcomers, I highly recommend the Little Italy Calzone 12" if you like a bit spicy food!
Their sizes are a bit on the small side but otherwise great value for your money.

I went and ordered food throigh their website. The order was rejected due to them being too busy which I totally understand. However they proceeded to charge me twice and took the money out of my account. I emailed them and have not received any response. I am really not happy with this and this is slmesomet that people need to be avare off

The pizza is very good. I would say 7/10. I have tried the piri piri one and calzone. The number of ingredients in calzone is perfect. No option to order garlic sauce. Only garlic mayo available which taste very average. It is so easy to make garlic sauce, it should be a problem for the pizza place. The delivery time was shocking, 1:35, during the week. I cannot imagine waiting time during the peak times. Furthermore, the place is quite dear. It is not real Italian pizza therefore price should be lower. Why do I need to pay extra fee while ordering online through your website. I see the potential but some changes must be done.
Bus services to Kasaragod and Kanhangad from Bangalore and forth... Good service with punctual on timing and good staff behaviour and cheaper.

Best service, "Kasaragod note swantham Kohinoor".
Easy to book tickets just by a phonecall. They give more impotance to the passengers. Comfort journey for Ladies. Even they are ready to wait till some one come pick the women passengers from d dropping point. Especially during early mornings. 
I am regular Traveller in Bangalore-Kasaragod route.
Daily services to kerala >Bangalore. Safe
Best Service......  On time ...... Reliable
It's in Gandhinagar and the quality of the service is not up to the mark. Office is too small and conjusted.
Nice and clean restaurant. Food was tasty. And prepare your cash when you go there cause they don't accept cards.
Simple but clean setting and ambience, great flavorful food. Good and polite service. Recommended place if you're a Thai food lover.

My first time coming here with family. For dinner. The waitress and waiter was friendly and did recomend good dishes for first timer. The environment was comfortable for family to dine in. I will come against n for my next meal.
Reasonable price for food
Good food good services. Quite authentic Thai cuisine, should give a try. After meal there's dessert

My fiance and I went here to celebrate our engagement. The food and atmosphere were amazing. Our waiter, Jon, was extremely attentive and made sure that we had everything we needed. He gave us some amazing suggestions on our food and I am so glad I listened to him about my selection. I had gotten the scallops, which were to die for. My fiance loved his tray of samples. We were so full that we didn't have room for dessert! But Jon was wonderful enough to pack it for us to go. He kept hot separated from cold and bagged it for us, which I greatly appreciated. I will definitely be going again, hopefully soon!!! I loved it!

The Tavern was an excellent dining experience.  The server had the menu memorized and explained the dishes to us in a way that made me want to try everything.  We opted for the tasting platters, so we were able to sample many of the mainstays of their menu.  We were seated near the kitchen, which is open for all the diners to view the artists at work.  The food was delicious, needless to say, and was immaculately prepared and presented.

The sushi we ate was tops! I only wish I could remember what it was called to reccomend it. It had a red garnish on top and it was gone in the blink of an eye! The food is also very fresh. And the place is clean and tidy. You get what you pay for here and I will be visiting again(soon hopefully!). Initially walking in we waited for someone to seat us which took a while and we just stood around waiting.
. When we were finally greeted we were asked if we had a reservation, we did not know we needed one. Lesson learned and this can be easily done online or by calling ahead. We were told they "would see what they could do"... even though they're were clearly plenty of seats we could see open in different section that the servers waited on. We just asked if we could sit at the bar to make it easier. The younger servers did tend to complain about things out on the floor around customers. It was busy though and we have all been there. This place is great for date night, family, and or friends to hangout. Highly reccomend!

My group of friends and I came to The Tavern on 2/9 for my birthday. We had reservations and were directed to our sectioned off private table. 

Our server, Julia, who I can’t praise enough, was amazingly accommodating. We brought in our own cake and she stored it in the back while we ate our meal, she recommended some delicious bourbon that the owner hand picked, and sent out some garlic butter edamame for the table. 

We ordered some apps - sushi, pot stickers, blackened shrimp, and creole crab cake. All were tasty, but my favorite was the crab cake. I had the 16 oz rib steak with lobster risotto and green beans. My wife tried one of the samplers to get a taste of four dishes. I believe the surf-n-turf. After the meal, 

I was delighted that Julia offered a house dessert. I picked the doughnut holes with maple bacon whipped cream because of the “sharability”. They came out with a lit candle. A truly awesome gesture. 

Thank you everyone at The Tavern for an tremendous birthday celebration.
Delicious cocktails and friendly service, would be happy to return to try more of the cocktail menu.

I was pleasantly surprised how good the food is here! It is a modest store front but don't let it fool you! The pizza is great, you can taste the freshness. Sooo much better than the big chain companies. The pasta was amazing! 12$ and you get a giant serving, enough for four bowls of pasta with garlic knots and a side salad. Highly recommend the napoletana linguine. Service was great too. They went out of their way to provide extra napkins and side of ranch.

Based on online reviews and its close proximity to my hotel, I ordered delivery during my stay in Ann Arbor.  I ordered a half Greek salad and an Italian sausage pizza.  The salad was pure perfection!  I highly recommend it.  The pizza was also very good (I enjoyed leftovers the next day, too).  I took off one star because the delivery didn't include napkins or utensils.  I mean, I'm staying in a hotel--do you really expect me to have these things readily on hand?  I had to go down to the front desk and request a plastic fork so I could eat my salad.  You guys have great food, so please don't forget the little things that travelers in hotels need.  :)

Just get pizza from this place. Chicken or Pasta is waste of money. Pizza is the best. Do not dine in. Order to go. Bathroom is horrible. They have cleaning problem. The lady who run the place trying her best she is nice. But they need to spend money on the place.

I don't know how this place has so many good reviews. I tried them for the first time last night and will not return. I stopped in for carryout pizza by the slice for my boyfriend and me. First of all, the layout of the restaurant is dysfunctional. The kitchen/working area is so small, I don't know how the three employees were able to move around. And that's another thing. The floor behind the counter has plastic pallets on it and the employees were walking around on the pallets. It was one of the strangest things I've ever seen in a pizza place. The cash register is on a small counter where other customers were just standing around waiting for their orders, so it was impossible to try to place my order and pay. After forcing my way to the register, I ordered two cheese and two pepperoni slices. The cashier could barely figure out how to price them. Cheese and pepperoni are the most basic thing you can order! There were two other customers waiting for their orders and the staff was clearly confused who was supposed to get what order. The employees were running around manically and acting like they could barely comprehend what was going on in the store with three customers! I also noticed there was no hand washing going on as food was being handled. No employee had a clear designated spot to work. They were all just doing whatever. Who manages like that? When I finally received my order they only gave me three slices. I repeated my order of two cheese and two pepperoni. A few minutes later I received my order in a small box and thought to myself "how in the world are there four slices of New York style pizza in here? Did the employee stack them on top of each other?" I was so annoyed I walked out to my car, opened the box, and guess what? Three slices of pizza stacked on top of each other. Unbelievable is all I could think. And who stacks pizza on top of each other? I walked back in and told them my order was still wrong.  A different employee took a slice of cheese pizza, threw some pepperoni on top, and put it in the oven. This is weird, right? Then she pulled it out of the oven and told me to have a great night in an extremely phony voice. She didn't even apologize for the poor service. When I was a teenager, I worked at Cottage Inn, a restaurant with a very large menu and variety of items. I could run the register, take orders, and make all the food by myself on a busy night. It might be hard, but I could certainly handle it on my own. This place can't even get pizza by the slice right with two attempts and three employees working. I was extremely embarrassed for them and would hate to see what it's like when they're actually busy. The pizza was mediocre. Try at your own risk!

My husband liked their pizza a lot and ordered from them dozens of times we recently moved and are now 4 miles away if you view the longest google map route. We have had them deliver before as the route max time also shows as 9 minutes after placing our order and waiting over 30 minutes we received a call back saying we are too far and they will not deliver to us, this woman is the same rude woman we have spoken to before. We were told it would be arriving in 45 minutes when we placed our order and gave our address and he took our payment information as usual. The correct thing to do would have been to call and apologize call back explain they would still deliver our order but in the future they will no longer deliver. She also stated we are over 6 miles away which is not true no matter what route you take. She said it's just too far and did not offer any apology. This is very expensive for what you get- we are dissapointes with our experience and would not recommend this and will be going to many of the other 50 pizza options instead from now on.

Kampung Nelayan floating restaurant, great place to spend with your loved ones or as gathering place...they have BBQ steamboat buffet..which cost rm38 per person. Marinated beef- highly recommended. The seafood is super fresh here. No time limit here. You can enjoy your food with cultural performance. Great places for gathering and family reunion. Highly recommended. Will come back again for sure.

Rm38 + 6% + 10% = you do the counting. Once a while i'll visit. Choices for prep food are average. Fresh prawns, beef, chicken and fish. But i don't favor their fish as it's dorifish. Not tasty at all. Tom yam soup was good just need to minimize that sweetness. Special performace starts at 7.30pm, i guess.
We ate their Spanish fired rice and it was great. We ordered it in large size which cost us 70 myr and it's totally  worth it. We able to share it among 5 people
Our dining place at KK. Good tastes, nice experience , culture shows . But some food came late, no supply of tissues, pricey.

Enjoy.. With family and Friends.
Relax can see the traditional dance..
